Sub par Restaurant . Booking price is always below what they charge. Still better than most other hotels in disgusting city of Lagos

My 4th floor room was just by the lift-hall. However the floor carpet was visibly worn is well due for replacement, while the repairs to the walls/joints still bear poor silicon jointings. Review Text: As soon as you walk into the hotel corridors you can smell the damp.. i stayed here for a total of 18 days. The first room i was in the walls were full of mould and every wall you touched was damp and wet. The bed sheets were clearly damp and the pillows smelt so bad. As the days went by the room smelt so bad that i couldn't take it anymore so i rang reception and asked them to change my room. Also this rooms shower flooded the whole bathroom and the water spread out into the main room which I'm guessing is what has causes the floor to be so mouldy and even the carpet smelt so bad! They were sticky and very dirty there was empty water bottles under the bed house keeping clearly didn't clean the rooms well. The next room i got to may have been worse at this point i was fed up of

Review Title: Value for money yes, but please inform about deposit policy
Review Text: A friend recommended the place and I got a weekend rate. I am pretty conversant with the Accor Group so I know what to expect. I would actually recommend this hotel. Their service is most certainly above the average ones in Nigeria.  However, personnel on duty at check in need to inform guests about deposit policy. Unless someone decides not to, it is natural to put bills to the room.

The workers are damaging the brand... Too many problems the state of cleanliness of the hotel is a problem... The service is very poor... They answer quickly yes sir without understanding a word of what you have requested and deliver you rubbish... Security is a concern as well as access is liberalised to the room floors and not by card access.

My wife and I stayed at the Airport road Ibis on the 24th of April 2017,I was dismayed to realize that they don't have guest assistance for your luggage which is very absurd,expecting a family to deal with between four to six luggages by yourself up to your room which can be on the fifth floor. The other problem is that the employees are very lackadaisical, they don't care for customers, they want to take your money but no passion at all and there's also no sense of urgency.

It was cool, the setting worked for me... Could be as dark as I wanted. However, I could hear people talk as they walk past and that wasn't so cool. I felt people outside could hear me too. Also, a bulb was flat but this didn't really bother me.

Review Title: The hotel was ok! Booking very acurate
Review Text: I like it and I will recommend , break fast was good and staffs was very friendly, the position of the hotel was good! Very close to the international airport which made is easier to connect to my flught! Always book my room with ibis!

The only reason now to stay here is the very pleasant staff. The hotel itself is in dire need of refurbishment of the rooms and maintenance now is negligible. I drew the following problems to the manager on one day but got no response:  1 - One lift was faulty and erratic in operation but still kept in service. The room I stayed wasn't that great. The rug smells, just a small bar soap in the bathroom (no shampoo, no body soap), and nearly got trapped in the elevator. However, their complimentary breakfast was okay and even though I was their with my wife, the breakfast was given to both of us as against some hotel who will give complimentary breakfast to just one person even if it is two people that are staying in a room.
Author Location: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates

Review Text: Very close to the Murtala Mohammed International Airport. Not expensive. Very secured. Great food choices. Food and drinks are very pricey. The hotel is easily accessible and a great place for a stopover.

No camera or CCTV in the hotel. I asked for

Biggest complaint was the music being played in the lobby. Bitc* and N***** in songs are not appropriate in the common area and guest should have a choice not to listen to that type of music. Said something to the desk clerks twice with no action taken. One of them said to me "what's wrong with it?" Other general staff very nice and helpful.  Close to airport is good. Was not use to having just one towel in my room but that appears to be common in Nigeria. Same breakfast every day - ok.  Meeting rooms were below standard. Inquired about having a quiet space for one hour with 2-3 people and the manager wanted to charge me a high price for half a day with lunch included. Not flexible at all and overpriced for rooms not getting much use, if any.   For the price and location, it is

My room was quit ok,a lot of noise from pool area due to a big party. The bath room was tidy but they had forgotten soap and shower gel. Tv channels  was ok , Electrics failure quit often that is normal eher in Africa.

Review Title: Getting tired and needs a refit
Review Text: I visited here a year ago and frankly its getting tired. The corridor of the upper floor I stayed on smells badly of mould, probably from either leaking showers or poor roofing.  Its conveniently located for the airport.  Traffic and parking locally around the airport is still a disaster and being close by gives some assurance that you should get your flight.

simple, clean and quiet. safe, comfortable bed and similar to ibis in other countries. food was good. close to the airport. Internet and tv worked. Cant really ask for more for a budget hotel. will stay again.

Review Title: Fine for a night, but look out for shake-downs.
Review Text: Hotel was safe, lobby very warm and humid, but the room was delightfully cool. Shower worked great, bed was comfortable. I used the pool, and it was very refreshing. Hall carpeting was quite dirty and stained. Breakfast was good, and the servers were very nice. Try the Zobo for breakfast. Had a few issues checking in, and had to move from the assigned room because the key did not work. We almost left before checking in because we were booked at a different Ibis. Man at the front counter wanted 10,000 Naira to take us a few blocks to the Ibis we had booked. Next day a taxi to the airport was only 2,500 Naira. I don't appreciate the shake down.

Standard Ibis room, which is very welcome in Nigeria. Restaurant and pool very nice. Exercise room ("gym") exceptionally good. Appreciated the security guard at the door. Only real disappointment is that they made us pay for bottled water, which I think should be included in the room price since most foreigners cannot drink Nigerian water.

Booked this property for a quick overnight stay as we were catching an early flight the following morning and wanted to avoid having to deal with notorious traffic jams that are typical in Lagos.   A quick note: there are apparently 3 Ibis hotels within relatively close proximity. We'd initially made the error of going to the hotel in Ikeja on Toyin st. though regrettably that obviously is a different hotel. Word to the wise: book this hotel instead. It is in a much better area with lots of eateries and the like around, the premises looks clean, aesthetically pleasing and inviting; plus, importantly, they offer Free shuttle transfers to the airport (which the Lagos Airport location does not).  On the other hand, Ibis Lagos Airport is the antithesis of everything mentioned above.
Review Text

I spent a night and chose this hotel because of its close proximity to the international airport. I was a little disappointed that i had to carry my luggage as there as no porter when i check in and also when i checked out. The rooms were clean, tidy and spacious.

I stayed here for a few days when my flight was canceled.   The hotel has the same quality and standard that can be expected from Ibis hotels worldwide.  The rooms are clean and spacious.  The staff is friendly and so helpful, especially with suggestions on how to get to local attractions.  There's no free shuttle to the airport, but there's taxis everywhere and the staff will actually help you book one if needed.  I had a wonderful stay here.

Neat, lovely small room. Stayed over for 1 night as i needed to catch a flight to London. Close proximity to MMA Lagos. Dinner buffet could have more options in my opinion. Also dinner is quite expensive (as expected). Was also able to get my room at 55% because of Black Friday sale (so can't complain :) )Overall lovely experience. Would return next time I'm in Lagos. Recommend

The hotel is located very close to the international airport so it's a good bargain for a one night stay if you need to travel the following day. When you get to the hotel it has a good atmosphere but really everything else is average at most. Staff was kind but seemed annoyed most of the time. Once I got to my room the door was already open, I found out later that it must have been because the electronic lock wasn't functioning. WiFi didn't work either. I complained both issues but none were rectified. Bathroom was big enough and clean but only had one towel and no rug in front of shower (nearly slipped getting out of the shower). I had dinner in their restaurant which had a small variety of choices from international and Nigerian food. Personally I liked the food but it wasn't

Review Title: Good place to stay near the airport
Review Text: The hotel building is in an ok condition and the staff is welcoming. There is a nice pool, the breakfast is ok and the restaurant menu, although limited, is ok too. There is an ATM within the compound but it was not working properly when I tried to use it.

IBIS as the brand name suggest stands to its reputation . Perfect match . Quick check in . Nice staff . Quick service . Nice ambiance . I love this place . Very near to the airport . Have reliable taxi service too . Definitely recommended .

I've been in lagos for 18 years and I have just been served the coldest nicest draught  Heineken I've had in Nigeria. Glass out of the freezer, lovely head. And incredibly refreshing........ lovely refreshing Surprise. Thank you   Don't normally end up here. Maybe need to try the rest of the facilities. Effort to produce a cold beer is real attention to detail that is rare in this neck of the woods

Good and a well located Hotel within Ikeja Lagos Nigeria, Nice attendants, neat rooms, good food, a little slow internet, Very close to the Airports both local and International, Close to shops and malls, easy access to various part of Ikeja and Maryland. Lovely place for families.

Review Title: Good location but in dire need of room refurbishment
Review Text: Good location but in dire need of room refurbishment. Spending seems to be on public areas and poolside rather than spending money even to replace a faulty toaster!. They need new mattresses and pillows (especially) in the rooms plus general refurbishment of the peeling laminate. They now have Golden Tulip opposite and I will be looking at that next time.

My wife and I frequently use the services of Ibis Lagos Airport and find the services to be decent and value for money.  The buffet though needs some reinventing as its standards seem to have dropped over the years for us frequent visitors.   The rooms though small are adequate and comfortable, with appropriate cooling systems.   A decent and quiet place for a weekend getaway. The pool area also has ample space and an alternative relaxation spot for visitors. It's proximity  to the local and international airports is a bonus.
Review Text

Review Title: Layover hotel on the way to USA
Review Text: The employees at front desk were helpful and security was good.The room is small with some sort of unnecessary room furniture taken up a lot of useful space.Food buffet at the hotel is very pricey and breakfast is not very qualitative.Complimentary breakfast is for one person per room. Overall not bad but not Exceptional neither.

Stayed at the hotel 2 times. Place was really neat, rooms are small as expected from a 3 star European style hotel. The breakfast buffet was great, very delicious and alot of variety. it's not expensive and very close to the international airport.

This hotel located near to Lagos Airport which about 15 mins drive. The room is small but room basic amenities is complete. Breakfast start from 4am-10:30am, limited choice. It is good for those who are in transit a night and value for money. Staff is well and helpful.

Those of you travelling in and out of Lagos this the best and most convenient so far, best to book via the net through trip adviser app you get good discount like 30 percent off. But the room where comfortable though small, the buffet had enough to cover every taste. Security was very good. There is bank next door with atm's that allows you to get cash with out the other fears. The taxi the hotel uses are good so has everything you need

I visited Lagos during April last week and stayed at IBIS near airport for 3 days. It is a good,secure property. Would recommend to all the business travelers. Rooms are clean. Though the washroom of my room was not so clean, so i changed the room. Wi fi signal is not so strong in few rooms. The staff was very friendly. All in all was satisfied with the stay.

Stay here often during work trips and find it to be exactly what you need for a decent price.  Food is fine, staff are polite and overall a decent hotel.  Security is as expected.  A lot of people around the bar and restaurant area for a chat and pool, outside facilities are more than reasonable.

Totally disappointed with how the basic services in the hotel has gone down in few months...Running water stopping in between shower,bad T.V picture quality and terrible internet reception..Before  I forget...Go with your ice if you need one

Very polite people, attentive staff, nice compact rooms. The hotel is close to the Airport, nicely located. The place seems secure.  Nice environment, great for trainings and sleep overs before travelling

Service was very poor from the very beginning, on my stay between May 25, thru May 27th. Upon my arrival I was received by the security guard/ doorperson whom offered help along with my luggage. The hotel representative at the counter did not offer anything resembling customer service since I had to gather and consequently drag both my very heavy luggage to the elevator. The surprise of my life I received when I entered the room and realized that it was very small that I had to store my luggage bags by the door in order to negotiate my way around the bed which was inches from the wall. I was further shocked when I entered the shower and encountered a single towel; despite it being a very expensive double room I paid for, no soap dish in the shower and not even a towel rack

Hotel Close enough to the airport (Lagos traffic makes it a longer ride). Modern in most areas, but could use improvements as the wear is starting to show. Overall the property is good it's some of the services that downgrade this hotel.  Pool area is nice.   Rooms  Standard European size, beds comfortable. Desk, chair, mini fridge. AC works well.  The downside is the rooms are very damp. Sheets, clothes will all begin to feel damp.  Bathrooms are decent however thewater will get onto the floor from the shower ( it's inevitable) and be careful as the floor will be slippery. They only provide one tower and they do not provide washcloths. Water pressure and hot water both good.  No iron in room. You can get your clothes laundered in about a 4 hour max turnaround.   Nothing really
Review Text

Wonderful staff.  I enjoyed the food.  Made me feel welcome.  Telling all my friends by in America how great this place is.  Thank You. Loved the breakfast buffet, unfortunately I found out late that I could've had my eggs special order.  And I will request waffles and pancakes next time.  Managers were very nice and sweet.

The Ibis Lagos Airport is a relatively new hotel set on the mainland of Lagos in Ikeja. A comfortable, hotel in a good location, it has nice rooms, friendly staff and good facilities. Convenient for the airport and business trips on the mainland

Review Title: my team and i had a fantastic experience. i personally enjoyed the Greek salad , pepper sauce with white rice was divine
Review Text: it was a wonderful experience especially the pool side awwww!  the sales manger was such a wonderful woman so down to earth . She made sure we were well taken care of. Guys look out for her. The  F & B manger was always there to make sure we get the best meal. it was awesome. The environment was serene  perfect for family. Their customer service is very good and their professionalism is outstanding. thumbs up guys.

Friendly staff, comfortable rooms. Delicious food. Great customer care.   A beautiful experience, serene environment. We checked in expectant and checked out happy and satisfied. Everyone should visit the IBIS hotel. Great place......

I have been a constant visitor at the hotel. The staff are friendly and courteous. They constantly have a smile on their face.  The service was also very spot on. The experience has always been excellent. Try it out.

l lodge some people at the hotel and no compliant what so ever.  they have manage the business relationship quite well and i am impressed especially with the account reconciliations.  i definitely will continue to work with them.

Review Title: Cool environment, friendly members of staff
Review Text: I was in Ibis hotel for business and I have also lodged there severally. You get value for your money, nice buffet, most friendly staff you can ever have in any hotel, efficient pick up and drop off at the airport, fast check-out procedure, nice and clean swimming pool, good view of Lagos if you stay in one of the rooms up there. There are also good facilities for trainings and seminars, access to reliable Internet facilities. Over all a great place to stay.

Review Title: Entirely Outstanding: People is very important....this is why i never stay in another hotel but Ibis.
Review Text: Ibis Hotel is always my second home in Lagos, from their rooms to their customer service which is second to none....their conference room is standard for all our meetings... the workers, managers, and everyone is happy.  Ibis Hotel is a family.... In Ibis Hotel, you get good price and even a discount. Fast wifi network, clean rooms, great pool side, nice colors....everything is just excellent.  I love Ibis.  Thank you Dear Team Ibis....you always make my stay and that of my company very proud of you.

Good the restaurant is ok but the security service is below expectation.The pool is fine but the internet do have issues .The mentainance hasn't got it right yet.Though Nigeria has gotten power problem but some hotel has find solutions by using automatic starter Genarator but Ibis hasn't got it right.

Was my 1st time to Nigeria. Arrived late night, reception staff was friendly & accommodating. Food was good. Allow me to book out late due to delay in connecting flights.  Assist me, arrange taxi to take me to exchange money. On my way from SA, will stay there again.
Review Text

Stayed at the hotel during a business visit to Lagos.  Arrived in late at Lago's Airport and the Ibis was a fantastic choice right near the Airport. Room was a typical Ibis but very clean When we arrived the restaurant was closed but they offered to prepare something for us anyway. In the morning the breakfast was a complete buffet right by the pool: very nice. The staff was friendly.  Most important: the security was very good as well, both at the entrance and within the premises

Review Title: Traveled to Nigeria on visit to see family
Review Text: Ibis hotel was very comfortable and clean which is not what you get in Nigeria. Because it is an international hotel the standard are better than a Nigerian run hotel. The rooms are small so if you have more than 3 visitors your room is full up. However you get meet in the reception area. Staff are courteous and have been trained on hotel hospitality, As in other hotels Nigerian staff are bad mannered and ignorant. Temi who 1 of the mangers so helpful and will sort out any issues that come ask for her if you stay.Breakfast was better than i expected and good again than other hotels in Nigeria. We stayed in the Sheraton in the past and the Ibis rooms are the same time. The only thing that better in Sheraton is there lobby and sitting are at the front of the hotel. Security is

This week I stayed at the IBIS Lagos Airport hotel. Quite expensive for a 3 Star rating but its comfortable. Eating at the hotel is inevitable unless you have someone local who can introduce you to the local restaurants. The hotel food is fair.  Staff are very helpful and friendly. All speak English. Rooms are basic but comfortable but you may have to get used to only one English TV channel [CNN] ... rest are all French.  It features a small but equipped gym and lovely pool in the back of the hotel.  Big plus is that its close to Airport ... this is important if you are not used to Lagos traffic.

I used this hotel for a quick layover between flights. Don't believe what you hear about it being 5-10 mins from the terminals. 30-40 is more the mark (it took me nearer 40 from the domestic terminal thanks to the abysmal traffic, and return to the international terminal was a good half hour)  Once arrived, the problems really began. The room was small and smelt musty and damp. Mould was forming on some surfaces (see pix). Not pleasant at all. Even the bedsheets were damp to touch and I was glad I was not staying overnight. On closer inspection the cause was clear - the window was sealed shut, meaning no fresh air at all.   Wifi - supposedly free and available in-room - did not show up on my phone so the routers evidently do not reach some parts of the hotel. Meanwhile there is

Stayed for a night with my family, the staff are nice, courteous and very helpful. Nice food, clean environment. Will definitely stay again. Their morning buffet starts as early as 4:40am... early travelers don't miss out on breakfast

From the first step inside the hotel I knew it was going to be amazing,  really clean, posh looking,  staff are nice. The buffet is amazing, but not a lot of vegetarian options at breakfast so it was just beans on bread for me lol. The WiFi has a good connection and the room was lovley only bad point is the shower wernt warm enough though,  that's why it's 4 stars and not 5. The bed is heavenly the only thing is only one pillow I sleep with two. I'm coming back loved my experience in Nigeria ðŸ’•ðŸ’•ðŸ’•ðŸ’•

Review Title: OK for a very brief stay. I'll stay again.
Review Text: Stayed just for 1 night. The staff are really nice & affable: always ready to go their extra mile to help you with a warm smile. It's a pretty old property. The wifi internet access worked well. The breakfast buffet breakfast could have been somewhat better (too many spicy Nigerian dishes that I couldn't eat), but I can't complain. My room was well equipped & clean: a fridge & tea making facilities were there. The place is very safe.

Stayed for one night waiting for a connecting flight and was impressed by the efficiency and safety offered by this hotel. It is well located and travel times from and to the airport acceptable. I arranged for pickup and drop off via telephone and this was also efficiently arranged with the transport being on time. Staff are friendly and helpful.

conveniently located near airport. best for early morning travel out of Lagos to Inland locations in Nigeria. extremely safe and well guarded. best and ideal location for business travelers travelling into Nigeria for Inland visits. well trained staff and concierge. neat and clean well made up rooms. healthy linen. breakfast needs improvement.

very pleasant hotel with best AC and comfortable room, I always checkin they when ever I enter naija, food is very okay, i like requesting for drawsoap with cemo and snail , staff that help me check in my luggage is a nice guy and the hotel has good security , even early morning the reception staff call my room line to remind me I will take taxi to local airport,
Review Text

This hotel does what it says  and its a great place to stop by at on arrival or for departure from Lagos airport. The staff were pleasant, Augusta who worked on reception was lovely & professional. The rooms are a bit small but the air con is very effective. The buffet breakfast is average . The pool is a lovely bonus. I felt safe and relaxed. Will return

Convenient location and very pleasant welcoming and friendly staff (except on reception). Nice pool and small gym. Food is OK with good selection. Rooms really need refurbishment  Looking very tired.Mattresses are so worn now they give me backache. Reception staff still not welcoming nor properly trained. Always has been the weakness here. Competition has opened over the road with Golden Tulip. Probably better and many special rates at present.

Clean and comfortable room, with good security. The atmosphere is pleasant and the gym is basic but not bad for a quick workout after a long flight. Most of the staff are polite and helpful - one of the ladies at Reception was great in providing assistance. However, the man who booked me in at Reception was spectacularly rude and should not be working in a hotel. Rather than speak to me, he preferred to grunt and make gestures with his hands. At N4,700, the buffet offers very basic food and is poor value for money.

I stayed at this hotel on two occasions in January on arrival in Lagos. The hotel is no more than 10 minutes from the international terminal.   The standard for a hotel in Lagos is exceptional. The rooms are clean and everything just works. For hotels in Lagos this is not the norm. They have a commitment to fix any problems within 15 minutes. On one stay the TV remote wasn't functioning, within 5 minutes of my call to reception an engineer arrived and replaced the batteries. All fixed.  Breakfast is a buffet and has a very good range of cereals, cold and hot items along with coffee, tea and juices.  The evening buffet is okay but make sure you don't arrive late. If you come in on a late flight it may be worth eating elsewhere. If you just require a snack there is a limited bar

Very conveniently located from the Airport. If you don't really need to go the main city, this is very ideal. The customer service is generally pleasant. The size of the rooms are a bit small and everything seems compacted.  I was surprised that they do not have room service.  Very good spread for the buffet, though they may need to alter the menu each day, it was the same spread the 3 days I spent there.

Perfectly located in between the international and national airports. Excellent for one night : rooms are very clean and functional. But but but...food is terrible - buffet style. All looks old on it, cover with a crust. In addition staff is terrible, almost rude. But who's not in Lagos hell?

Even though it's on a very busy street, all the hustle and bustle of the city is shut off once you are inside the hotel. Very friendly front desk staff, small rooms as typical of the Ibis chain. The cleaners unfortunately, are not too good at their task.

Fair rate for Lagos.  Helpful caring staff.  Clean rooms.  Small but clean.  AC works very well.  Food mediocre and expensive for what it is.  Very close to airport.  But definitely a taxi ride.  About 12 -20 for taxi ride to airport depending on how you negotiate it.   Front staff can get you a taxi but that is more expensive than getting your own.   Hotel is relatively safe by Nigerian standards.  Clientele mostly travelers.   Wifi was a problem and did not have "working" wifi in my room for most of trip although wifi is advertised as part of room features.   Had to change rooms to get minimimum wifi maybe it was a closeness to server issue.

Review Title: International standard hotel in Lagos at a reasonable price - a rare find
Review Text: Comfortable bed, quiet, efficient reception, good breakfast and dinner buffets, good size swimming pool, easy location from airport, great price via internet. What more could you ask for? Actually one thing - they could give use of iron/ironing board instead of having to pay. But laundry service was fast so can't complain too much.

Overall my stay was a good one as I had value for money. My shock was how the Hotel has allowed an adjacent low class local hotel to name itself as Ibis and thereby confusing first timers like me! When I got down the plane I took a taxi and the taxi driver told me confidently told me he knows the hotel and drove me to that fake IBIS which is just one block away from the real Ibis. Later I found out that if he had been able to convince me to stay at that fake ibis, he would have been given a commission of 4,000 Naira! Management of ibis should check this as they are passing off!
Review Text

Arriving and leaving from Lagos airport is generally a bad experience. If it rains or there is a traffic issue, which there generally is, then you have to be close to the airport to be sure you arrive on time. It can take you over an hour just to cover half a mile and parking unloading and loading bags is a mess. Ibis Hotel makes this experience easier and convenient before you travel on elsewhere in Nigeria or back home. I don't like the quality of food much but thats my own opinion. I haven't found any where else different and it is typical. If you are two in a room make sure they give you two of everything as it is not standard and getting an extra towel for example can take a long time. Forget the 15 minute promise and sort it out at check in immediately. We gave up waiting.

Review Title: Fast and simple hotel in Lagos Airport area
Review Text: This is typical Ibis hotel. Easy, simple and very close to airport. I have been this hotel several times for short stays. With European expectation, it is just average but for Lagos it is good. For me the food variety and availability is negative feature for this hotel. I suggest, whom has to stay in Ikeja for short stays. Also cost effective. The free wifi is good for Lagos standard.

I stayed with a group of five for a week, which is probably longer than the average stay. The hotel was convenient, clean and comfortable, and most of the amenities were functional. The buffet food was reasonable, and we especially enjoyed the fresh fruit. The rooms were comfortable if a little soulless (a few pictures on the walls would cheer them up, for example). The beds were comfortable and the AC wasn't noisy and worked well. In addition, our rooms on the third floor were very quiet so our sleep quality was excellent which was great. The wifi sometimes worked in the rooms, but was better in the restaurant, although in the early evening we sometimes couldn't access it due to too many users. The staff were all courteous and helpful, although didn't engage as much as other

Hotel had everything I needed for my one night business stay. Situated in a quiet, secure and walled location near the airport, the hotel has very good WiFi, a nice restaurant and food, a swimming pool, gym etc. Comfortable beds, rooms not as big as most but clean and well serviced. The staff was very friendly, polite and helpful.  Seems security is very important, as elevators and floors require card access key entry. Reasonably priced and a very pleasant and safe environment. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here every time I am in Lagos.

Friendly, competent staff, clean modern reception area, clean somewhat cramped rooms (Ibis trademark, I guess!); great overnight or a couple of days' stay - on arrival or pre-departure; very convenient location to airport, especially for early flights. I prefer the Ibis Ikeja location, though - easier access to things to do - lounges, restaurants, business Ibis is very much no frills, but this has just enough for a short stay to be comfortable and stress free

Had to stay here for one night after arriving after sunset at the airport. The next morning we would transfer to the company compound. The room was very comfortable and wifi was decent. The buffet available for dinner was not very appealing, but after some carefull selecting, did get the job done. Felt very safe the whole time and would stay here again when in Lagos.

It was a brief stay for one night. Staff were very helpful and the rooms are clean. The typical Ibis no frills. Breakfast was good and included in the room rate. The proximity to the airport means a lot especially as most international flights arrive into Lagos at night.

Review Title: AVERAGE ROOMS - GOOD STAFF AND FOOD
Review Text: Overall impressed with my visit - Rooms were clean and comfortable, food cooked well and nice staff. Good value for money and in good location to airport. Enjoyed my stay - only criticism was having to wait for too long at the reception when initially checking in but overshadowed by general staff friendlyness

This hotel does not clearly honour the accor membership programme. I was not given the preferences i normally receive as an accor gold member in other participatory hotels.  The lady that checked me in was just not interested in seeing my membership card, all she was after was my international passport which i found strange.

We stayed 9 nights at this hotel. We have stayed in many Nigerian Hotels over the last two years. They are overpriced and generally fall down on basic hygiene. So we decided to go with a business chain. I warned the other half that the rooms would be small and basic. However to my amazement this was the first time that she accepted the room she was given. The rooms are clean but small. The shower pressure is brilliant. A/c is good. Security is very tight with armed police. Reception and bar staff very helpful and polite. Food is good but you get bored after four or five days. General manager is very approachable. Junior staff on reception need to communicate better. Special thanks to Ernest, very professional on the bar and Happiness on reception, a beautiful smile and always
Review Text

Helpful and friendly staff. Clean rooms. Nice environment. Safe and secure hotel location that is only 10 minutes to the airport. Good value for money. Late arrival is guaranteed. Great service. Quality bed and pillows that guarantee quality sleep.

Nice clean Hotel, nearby the airport. Good service and nice surroundings. Only no hot watter for the shower in the morning. Nice swimming pool and service on terras. Beside the buffer also good smaal snack card.

Review Title: Comfy and nice at a discounted price
Review Text: Came in without a booking, checked the rack rate and online rates..got almost 40% off online, and at that price its worth it. This is a bigger place than the Ibis at Ikeja, but the kitchen somehow doesn't offer the same variety at breakfast or dinner. There was a station for omletes but nobody manning it! Stuck to eating out afterwards. For me the closeness to the airport was important, as could easily wrap up meetings in the hotel itself. Net connection was not really upto the mark, kept going on off often and there were mosquitoes in the seating are next to the bar! Overall though the rooms were maintained.

This hotel is located about 20 minutes (with traffic) from the international airport.  This makes is a good choice for travellers who are flying in or out of the airport.  The hotel offers a shuttle service to and from the airport and I have found that this service is always reliable.  The hotel itself is comfortable with a modern decor but certainly does not offer too much in the way of frills.  This makes it good for a short stay.  Breakfast buffet was reasonable.  Dinner buffet had a large selection but only about half of the items on offer would cater for a western palette.  My major gripe is the hot water supply.  I struggled to get hot water in my shower even after running the shower for 10 mins.  This happened twice in different rooms.  All in all a good value for money

My second stay reinforced my good impression.  Yes, the rates are high (this is Lagos...), the rooms are simple (this is Ibis and Lagos...), the internet sometimes fais (this is Lagos...).  But compared to other hotels, this is a very good option. The staff is friendlier than average, led by a very competent manager. The airport is easily reached, perfect for me. The only improvement I would wish is the menue: if you^re there for a week, it starts getting boring...  Overall very recommendable!

Review Title: If you want basic you will find it here!
Review Text: Unfortunately I was sent to Lagos in Nigeria for a business trip my last trip here was in the 80's....nothing as changed. Due to the horrendous road congestion I decided to stay at a hotel closest to the airport to make sure ithat I was in time to catch my outbound flight.  My Office booked me into the IBIS hotel, the location was good for the airport, the room was basic but comfortable, everything else was such a low standard including, non attentive Staff, food and general attention to detail, if you want basic then stay here!

Our crew always stay here en route offshore. It's a nice hotel, even by western standards. As always in Nigeria, the power will go out a couple of times during your stay, but no worries, back up generators work like a charm. Food at the hotel is average. Breakfast is good. Wifi is very much appreciated.

Review Title: Transit Hotel on route off shore
Review Text: A nice Hotel run by lovely staff where nothing is to difficult. The rooms are clean and basic and in my case this time a little dated looking.  The restaurant is very basic and the food minimalistic, its not to everyones taste and after a few days its very repetitive.  However in the context of a bed/food and location in West Africa it ticks all the right boxes. A wee warning the bar prices are high and may catch you unaware.  I will however return when the situation presents its self and recommend if transiting Lagos then give it a go.

Review Title: Safe, comfortable and good value for money
Review Text: The hotel is close to the airport and in secure location. Very close to shops and amenities. The premises is clean and of international standard. Constant power supply, free WiFi and very polite and helpful staff.

I stayed here whist waiting for a connection offshore. The hotel is clean and friendly and the outside swimming area was quite nice except because of the monsoon it was impossible to  use it.  I noticed other single guys and there was plenty of lady friendship available for them to take their choice from. Sorry not my scene.  Food Buffet was well set out and plenty of choice. Due to the security I was unable to leave the complex but it certainly looked lively outside the boundary walls.
Review Text

Review Title: Top quality for a budget hotel
Review Text: A breath of fresh air to arrive in this hotel. Clean, fast and efficient for a pocket friendly solution! Rooms are top price/quality and with the proximity to the airport this hotel offers the best solution for travel related business stop overs.  WiFi is good and the food/buffet caters for both Nigerian and international travelers.

Review Title: Good place to stay in Lagos
Review Text: I was in Lagos for 2 days on a business trip. The entrance of the hotel is guarded so you can feel safer. The hotel itself is conform to what Ibis brand is offering. The breakfast was good and tasty. There is nice swimming pool  which is very enjoyable. The general manager is very friendly like the staff in general. I definitely recommend this hotel

Review Title: A welcome return to this Hotel in Lagos
Review Text: Having been a regular user of this Hotel for a couple years I am happy to say its most definitely heading in the right direction.  Bearing in mind its not top end luxury, its a good all round package and you get what you pay for.  Peter the Manager has worked diligently to ensure procedures and facility's are working well.  The check in was fast and simple, the rooms clean and adequate although some rooms still require a little TLC.  The food on the buffet is good and generally covers everyone's pallet. The internet is intermittent at best, as are the fairly frequent power cuts that this area of Lagos is susceptible too.  The pool & Gym facilities are good and enhances the stay somewhat.  My only observation and not a complaint was only one person on the reception early morning,

The name "airport hotel" implies that this hotel is much closer to the airport than it actually is.  It's about fifteen to twenty minutes from the airport, and depending on the time of day, this can be much, much longer.  Lagos traffic is a nightmare.  While there are hotels that are closer, this one is probably my favorite.  As with most chains, there are few surprises.  Reservation system is dependable, the hotel is generally quiet, grounds are secure, and there is an attached restaurant and bar.  There is not much to do around the hotel.  Once you're there, you're there.  Nearly everyone here is coming in for a late flight, and leaving early so the options around the hotel are very, very slim.  If you're looking to get out and about, there are better options.  If you're

I was very much satisfied with the services and i will always stay at ibis whenever i visit Nigeria. I will also recommend ibis to my friends. Keep up with the good work. One thing lacking a shuttle bus to the airport

Staff are very welcoming rooms are small bed comfy shower good food good always something for everyone to eat I stayed at the Ibis Hotel for four months great hotel for Lagos. I stay at the DePalms that's a different story !

I stayed 3 nights at this hotel.   My comments take into consideration that i've been in Nigeria before, so i don't compare it to European standards, but to Nigerian.   Having said that, I was quite pleased with the hotel.  - It's expensive - but compared to other hotels good value - It's an IBIS - means don't expect exclusive amenities, room service etc. But if you don't need this, and don't care for "impressing" others with sounding brands, you'll like it. - It's located in a different area from most other hotels - but the same distance to the airport or Lagos Island as others - The rooms are not huge, but absolutely acceptable for one business traveller - Bed is good, air conditioning is good (yes, you can control the actual temperature!), Internet is good when there are not

I was worried about the varying reports but as always made my own mind up. But, to help others (and balance out the reports) exactly as expected. Courteous reception. Clean quiet room. Very comfortable bed. Roomy shower. Breakfast bufet open from 04:00 which is just right for my 07:00 flight from the conveniently close airport. Minus? The surly kitchen chef...but wouldn't you be surly at 04:00? Can recommend

Review Title: What a pain to get Internet access
Review Text: Spent nearly a week with 3 days with no access and 3 days with constant disconnections. The rest is basic. The only good moment is the swiming pool at the end of the day. So very difficult to enjoy the 150â‚¬ spent per day

Review Title: Convenient for airport, swim and basic accommodation
Review Text: My first trip to Lagos. Shocked at hotel prices which are way above average. This is well over Â£100 per night for standard Ibis quality. Meaning you get a small basic room with standard stuff in it and thats it. I did one night stay and came back a week later for a quick swim before late departure from airport. Although I've given it an 'average' review (you seriously can't give it more) it could save you a missed flight from the airport which is about a mile away or closer. That very short trip can take 2-3 hours and its chaotic. Food is safe and Western. Wifi works and its free. Taxi to airport is Â£10-15 one way with usual nonsense from anyone involved in processing the money.
Review Text

Review Title: Exactly what you would expect from IBIS
Review Text: I stayed for a week and had hot water, decent shower pressure, an AC that worked, and clean room and bathroom all week. This is more than I can say of another 'luxury' hotel I previously stayed at in Lagos that cost almost twice as much.   Yes, the rooms are not huge and the food could be better, but bed was comfortable, sheets clean, free wifi ... and Hotel has a decent sized pool (20m?), outdoor area, and gym. My room, overlooking the pool, was very quiet, I am guessing that the rooms facing the street may be noisier. And being 10-minutes from Lagos Airport saved me many hours of Lagos traffic ...   For Lagos, this is good value ...

The rooms are well planned, bed is excellent, bit crowded if there is two people. Excellent breakfast. Staff not too friendly. Close to airport, noise level can be bothering. Security good in that only room key give you access in lift to your floor.

Am ok but watch and improve for example the room I stayed this time had no fridge. it had in my last trip. The room is ok so also the location. The breakfast is fine too but I wish more options be made

This was my second time at the ibis lagos airport hotel. I guess I wasn't excited about the second stay as much as the first. 200 dollars for a budget hotel sheesh. Stay near to get to the airport earlier. It's comfortable for foreigners who want a renowned name brand. Breakfast is ok.   Pros.  Hotel was quite neat and quiet.  The bar stays open till late if you can afford it.   Cons.  No concierge policy is very bad considering how cheap labour is in Nigeria.  No store to get toiletries. Forget a tooth brush and you're on your own.  Expensive bar. Very pricey.   Ask for a room looking over the pool if you're Nigerian. Foreigners might find the view of the highway interesting.   Will grudgingly stay again.

Review Title: Close to airport, no frills and efficient
Review Text: Got a good rate through my company.  Simple check in.  Very simple room.  Exactly one coffee cup and one instant coffee sachet! :-) Coming from a long international flight and extra health checks at the airport, it was great to check in without any hassle.  If you are not looking for luxury or high service, Ibis is quick and efficient.  Would recommend as a quick first stop since its close to the airport.  Definitely not for a long stay, since you will have to get to Ikoyi/VI for any social activity.

The services were excellent, The room was neat and clean just as always.The location is as I wanted it - close to the the airport and exclusive. The amenities were world class and well maintained. The buffet service at the restaurant and the cuisine were perfectly delicious with varieties to suite many tastes. For always I enjoy all the services but for the free Internet WiFi that was epileptic throughout my stay

This is what an Ibis hotel is supposed to be. Efficient, clean, budget, no frills no thrills. Friendly welcome, good check in, nice normal food, good wifi and good location close to the airport.  Its nice to see a simple standard working flawlessly in Lagos.

I called  the  hotel ahead  of time to get the best possible  rate and I was quoted 25,000 naira per night  and to schuelde airport pickup.  When  I arrived  it was 27,000 instead no airport pickup. I ate at the hotel food was good but  no room service  and no food covers. Not much to do around that side of town.

The Ibis has all the amenities that a Lagos weary traveler could want, clean sterile  rooms, consistent wifi, food that isn't spicy :).  But- the hotel is absurdly overpriced and nickel and dimes guests on everything. Buffet for dinner costs nearly 50 USD and is basically the same stuff they put out for breakfast.  I also had the unpleasant experience of having a bold as you like cockroach crawling all over the coffee supplies. To be certain - it is the ultimate non-lagos experience- you could be literally anywhere in the world for all you would know inside the hotel. I think they take full advantage of travelers who are too timid to explore Lagos. Additionally the staff is a mixed bag- there are some truly lovely and helpful people at the front desk but in the bar/restaurant

This is a standard Ibis hotel (part of Accor group).  Stayed there for business long-term in Nigeria.  Close to the airport.  The breakfast is decent with the option of making egg dishes at no extra cost.  The rooms are standard Ibis size, clean, and comfortable.  WiFi can be a tad slow at times.  Staff are very friendly and professional.  Would stay here again.

Review Text

I arrived the hotel at noon, two months after my last stay; I noticed that tea sets (tea cup / sugar /electric kettle etc.) had been placed in the rooms , but no bottled water. when I complained, the receptionist advised that I use water from the bathroom. Hmmmmm. Even for a Nigerian, the buffet lunch lacks appeal, no variety!. I hope someone is noticing. There's still no door man. You have to hold the entry door with one hand while maneuvering your luggage trolley....only for the receptionist to give a meaningless toothpaste - welcome -  smile after struggling your way in. So ironic.

Review Text: Iâ€™ve used this â€œhotelâ€ for only 4-5 hours on a â€œday-useâ€ basis before flying-out back home. Thank God this was only a few hours!!!  For Managementâ€™s info: I was in room 137.  The â€œroomâ€: you get in there and the humidity smell catches you and never leaves. Mold everywhere: of course (kidding) around the shower the caulking was all black, but mold was also visible (clearly visible) on the ceiling above the mirror. The paint needed more than a touch-up. The immigration officials had given me a rough time and i was very tired to notice the tiny rooms. A funny smell emanated in the corridor...  The bathrooms were much smaller.  The breakfast was great but did not enjoy it much given that we had a plane to catch.  In fact I just slept for 3 hours!

I stayed at the hotel in September, 2012. Had booked the hotel online and we found that the hotel was waiting for us. I spent a few hours at the hotel as i was on transit to Gambia. The hotel has tiny rooms and the rooms are carpetted which is not  nice as they are not vacuumed daily. The staff are helpful and we got a wake up call to head to the airport on time.The breakfast was good.

My family and I stayed for 6 nights; even spent the Christmas in this hotel.. It was an amazing experience for all of us especially for the kids. They had access to 24hrs internet, and they loved the pool, breakfast was awesome!  The staff initially took a while to warm up, I guess they were stressed at the time we were checking in, and however they were awesome throughout our stay.   There is a lot of variety to choose from during breakfast; even the most selective eater will be able to find their choices.   I am looking forward to our next holiday.. We will definitely be staying at this particular branch (Ajao Estate). The kids felt at home all through their stay.  The downsides is that some of the rooms did not have fridges which was the ones I was placed, do insist on

Review Title: One star at four star prices.
Review Text: The rooms were booked online but no money taken so if locals booked we would have been without a room. At Â£240 for two rooms this place is expensive.  Stinky corridors stinky rooms dirty filthy carpets and dirty stink pillows had to use my own sheets to cover the stinky pillows. Slept ok though. One slaver of soap.  Breakfast included nice choice of foods. Ok service. No one to help with bags. Proper budget hotel but at over 50,000 naira a night an absolute rip off.   Stayed in a brand new spotless clean hotel in the east a presidential suite with people to carry bags for 27,000 naira a night and one for 35,000 near airport.   IBIS get your act together how can you charge double the uk room rate and offer half the service. Especially the stink and the filthy carpets in the room.

Being a fan of Ibis in Europe, so I am naturally down to the Ibis Lagos Airport. any deception, dirty room, sheets and pillowcases smelled very bad, as if they had not been washed. To wash me, a simple piece of soap and a tiny shower gel. The restaurant, it was a long time I did not eat so badly. The staff, I think, the bottom is key reception everyone speaks, and the customer expects, staff room, they do not know it exists a vacuum to clean the carpet in the room; restaurant I think that there is no staff, we never see anyone. .... Some positives to finish, the pool, the bartender a little fat, a tall, thin technician and a girl all frail, in rooms, three people who helped me find the Ibis service. Just a question, where are, and what are responsible for service.

This Ibis is now under new management. Peter De Bondt has been passed the Baton by Richard Robaix who was the founder G.M of this peaceful haven in bustling Lagos. Friendly staff, a clean well maintained hotel with good food are keys to my repeated visits. Free wifi throughout the hotel, clean air conditioned bedrooms with all facilities ensure relaxation after a day in the awesome Lagos metropolis. Well done Peter and your team.

Review Title: Ideal for short business trips, airport transfers....
Review Text: Rooms are a bit small, but ok for short stays...excellent showers and facilities that work! Buffet good but limited ala carte menu....close to the domestic and international airport in Lagos. Very friendly staff that make you feel very welcome.

Spent 2 nights at this hotel. You get the best rates on the Ibis website and are good value. It is useful that the hotel is close to the airport making it good for flight crews and catching early flights. The rooms are the typical Ibis room style but the lobbies to the rooms need to me worked on. (Looks old and tired). The staff were also good and polite.
Review Text

Review Title: Terrible Hotel, Exteremely Rude Personnel, Untrustable
Review Text: I booked my a room from this hotel online thru a prominent online travel site. I paid for the room and got confirmation. I and my colleagues arrived at the hotel and this was when we are told they can't give us a room. They made us wait for 20 min not telling us what happened and why we are been waited. They were very rude and their attitude was insulting. They said they have a system issue then they said their rooms are under maintenance then they said even if it was not under maintenance they couldn't place us. So we asked to speak to the manager to get a refund or to be placed in another equivalent hotel. They said they can refund thru the agent and no earlier than a week. They offered us to place a no name hotel/hostel. We did not accept. And at the middle of the night after

Not a comfortable one. Only shampoo in the hotel room. was traveling out next day through the international airport and behold, no body lotion, nothing of that  stuff to make a guest comfortable. I even called front desk to request for the body lotion and response was negative. No room service.

I would suggest porter and room services be considered. It is very inconveniencing to wake up at 2am and come downstairs just for a glass of water. Porter services would be highly appreciated for guests with heavy luggage. Apart from these, I really enjoyed my short stay and would always recommend Ibis to my colleagues.

Staff failed to inform me on check in,that the wifi, and TV services were down. And I could not sleep during the day, because of contruction or demolition work , happening in the hotel. I also observe room service use the wet used bathroom towel, to wipe the dinning table in my room. The food in the restaurant was very good. The price is definitely good value for money. Hopefully the hotel management will train the staff better after reading this.

Review Title: Good Value and Safe a Hotel in Lagos
Review Text: I have written about this hotel before as as it continues to improve wanted to give it a more positive review.  Since it opened the resident manager Richard worked very hard to produce a very professional team and improve the niggles like the damp smell  in the corridors (now no more) and slow wifi (now greatly improved but still has it's bad days). The restaurant provides a good quality of food despite being a buffet in addition to the snack menu. The quality of finishing in the rooms still could be improved but I understand they are being upgraded slowly. One thing that is very good are the new very comfortable beds I always have a great sleep on them. Richard has now been transferred to Benin and his replacement Peter seems to be a hotelier cast from the same mold as Richard.

I have used this Hotel on numerous occasions now, its Location for transit is great and the staff there more than happy to help with all needs. The security at the gate is welcomed and keeps unwanted revellers away.   The rooms are adequate and generally value for money, the tea/coffee facilities once again do not have milk and when requested none available!!  I do however need to highlight the menu, which for my 3rd visit on the trot still does not have items available and when I enquired was informed its to expensive to buy in!!! I commented then why are these items still on the menu to which I was given a smile and no answer.   The Ibis Hotel has a good name and must endeavour to keep this by addressing these smaller issues to return to the standard shown during my first

The Ibis (Accor) is a good solution for overnight stays in Lagos. Rooms are very small but clean, adequate, the wifi works well. Front desk is very friendly and efficient, service is professional, buffet is good quality. The gym does not exist yet (unless two treadmills in a small storage room can be called a gym) They have transportation to and from airport. They even answer emails and you can reserve via email.  After the chaos of Lagos airport it is a welcome change.

I have used this Hotel on numerous occasions now, its Location for transit is great and the staff there more than happy to help with all needs.  The security at the gate is welcomed and keeps unwanted revellers away.  The rooms are adequate and generally value for money, the tea/coffee facilities once again do not have milk and when requested none available!!  I do however need to highlight the menu, Which for my 3rd visit on the trot still does not have items available and when I enquired was informed its to expensive to buy in!!!  I commented then why are these items still on the menu to which I was given a smile and no answer.   The Ibis Hotel has a good name and must endeavour to keep this by addressing these smaller issues to return to  the standard shown during my first

Great place! Myself and family  had a great time. Nice restaurant, bar, swimming pool, parking space and clean environment. In a place where safety is critical, Ibis Lagos gave some feeling of security. It also pretty accessible since it is 5 to 10 minutes away from international and local airport. However, i missed room service staff and helpers who help in carrying bags.

First time in Nigeria, Very nice hotel, enjoyed the food, internet service and pool area. Staff were very professional and nice, Very close to the airport, cabs outside. Would not advise anyone to travel alone. Loved Nigeria but it is not for the faint of heart. Lots of business people were there. We did have some issues with the rooms could use major cleaning, and odor in the hallways. But overall enjoyed our visit. The photos on the website are true to the hotel. Would return.
Review Text

It was my first stay at Ibis Lagos Airport and everything worked perfectly fine. The communication prior to my stay in terms of booking the room and arranging pick-up from the airport was friendly and straight forward. On arrival check-in was welcoming, quick and easy. My room was on the 1st floor overlooking the pool, so no noise from the road at all. Breakfast from 4.30am until 12pm is a generous period of time, but better go before 10am if you fancy scrambled or fried eggs, bacon and sausages because they are absolutely yummy and therefore most likely finished by then. I stayed for 10 days and throughout this time the staff was friendly and always helpful when there were questions or issues, i.e. telecommunication problems with my devices, transport or arrangement of local

As a matter of fact it is in a good location with respect to the local and international airport. Security around the premises not bad, cameras could be extended along the corridors, entrance double door could be changed to auto remote doors even the one that leads to the pool from the bar. Thank God the mosquitoes have been dealt with as compared to when it started. Kitchen staff is very good, I give them that, the food is very good. The rooms oh my God could be better finished, poor finishing, good items but bad wood finishing and paint in the room/ bathroom area. Reception desk, very good staff but don't look too happy working, if your staff is not happy then management should step in. IBIS is a chain hotel, I have always visited in Cameroon, Morocco, Malabo all around Africa

Hotels are usually very expensive in Nigeria, could not fathom what was in this Hotel to warrant a $200+ a night fee. The rooms are small, the rug dirty, we had to change rooms to find one that didn't have Ã¡n odour. The place will fall apart in a year if not give a face lift.

This is my second stay at this hotel within six months. It is very convenient from the international airport. The team of staff there are very friendly, they always try to help whatever the situation. It has easy access to all parts of Lagos, unlike if you stay on the Island where access to mainland lagos is dependent on the traffic on the three main bridges. I would recommend it to anyone from Europe because of their customer service attitude. There is one area of improvement I would like to suggest and that is the car service I requested did not arrive until after 30 minutes I cleared immigration. I did not like waiting around at the airport. Otherwise it's a nice hotel.

The good thing about Ibis is that you generally get the corporate offering. In this case it was almost there and considering the Nigeria effect it is OK. Its not too far from the airport (about N3000 by taxi). Layout and reception was as you would expect - the rooms were not so good. Grubby round the door handles and stained carpets but clean bed linen and towels in the bathroom. The rate for the Ibis is $150 which in most places would be over the top but is average for a hotel in Lagos. Breakfast was really good!! A real bonus and a good way to start the day. Would I stay again - perhaps Did I 'enjoy' my stay - not really Recommend - if you are passing through, then yes  Do bear in mind that hotel service levels in Nigeria and maintenance quality are subterranean. Review Title: Great Service, But in Need of a Renovation
Review Text: Yes, this hotel is in Nigeria, but that's no excuse for letting the rooms go into disrepair.  In my room there were stains on the carpet, the TV was really small and the bathroom smelled moldy.  Service in the restaurant was inattentive and the food was expensive and mediocre.  The hotel is very close to the airport, which is its primary advantage.  If not for that, I would have spent another $100 for the Sheraton.

Stayed in this hotel for my short trip for a board meeting in Lagos. My room ( 251) was on the 2nd floor with poor view. The rooms were neat and serviceable. The air conditioning was good. The major advantage of this hotel is it's proximity to the airport (local and international). The meals were nice with a wide variety of African and continental cousine. However the service is slow. You need to order for your meals especially breakfast one hour ahead of time. while the rooms are neat the corridors and walkways require a little more attention. The environment is difficult and noisy. This hotel is average in it's quality of service.

I have read some of the other reviews and decided to book here for an overnight business stay. The hotel is very conveniently located close to the airport - if you are just transiting through Lagos, this is a plus due to the normal Lagos traffic (which is hectic at the best of times). Don't be fooled by travel times quoted between hotel and airport - it is totally unpredictable in Lagos.  The room rates are very reasonable compared to others in Nigeria.The room rate included breakfast.  Yes the rooms are not very big, but I don't mind if it is just for transit purposes. The room was clean and very comfortable - I had a good night's rest after about 6 hours on the road. The bed and pillows was designed for weary travelers. Staff were friendly and the restaurant was good

The Ibis at Lagos airport is not cheap for what you get, but is a thoroughly serviceable hotel. My room (211) was clean and had pretty much the softest and most comfortable bed I've had in ages. I had a brilliant nights sleep.   Dining choices are limited, but up to scratch. Due to arriving late evening, all I could manage was a cheeseburger at the bar, and it came with a good portion of fries. Burger itself was cooked well, and nothing to complain about.   Breakfast is good, although I felt some of the hot dishes could be hotter. The fruit is great, as was the bread and pastries.   Not used the pool, but this can be seen from the bar and looks clean and well kept.   The staff I have dealt with have always been polite and efficient. I've had no reason to complain about anything,

Review Title: Very good in a difficult environment.
Review Text: A wonderful recluse from the noise outside! I've stayed in several places around Lagos but the Ibis is the one that you can rely on. Lagos is unpredictable and totally different from any other place I've been, I realised that pretty quickly. It is important to think about this before writing a review. The hotel is very comfortable, the staff are very friendly, the pool is wonderful and the hotel grounds are immaculate. The hotel manager makes you feel welcome, he takes the time to come and have a chat and even remembers your name! Anywhere you stay in Lagos you will have problems. It just depends on how quickly they are addressed! The Ibis was very good from my experience.  Thank you Richard.

This hotel is over priced and not well maintained. I travel for a living and I have never stayed at a hotel that does not provide wash cloths or hand towels.  In the bathroom there was a hole  between the door and the base of the shower. The beds are a very thin form pad on a wood panel board. The television is a 13 inch flat screen that needs to be a Childs room.  A CRUISE SHIP ROOM IS BIGGER THAN THIS! This hotel should not have been rated as a 4 star. The online pictures of this facility is no where close to reality. My personal belongings has been stolen and reported to the manager and nothing has been done. I will never recommend this Hotel chain to anyone.

I am just staying in Ibis Airport and I will check in next time again. Main reason is location ( close to Airport ) and price / value based on Nigerian level. Rooms are small but not too small, breakfirst very good compared to other hotels in Nigeria, lunch / dinner availabe. Some points to improve: No save in the room, the matress in my room is not the newest ( means, hollow in the middle ) and the snacks in the bar could be little more healty ;-). Spa: good pool outside but fitnesscenter (more fitnesbox) is very basic. However, good choice.

Before you reach the Ibis Hotel from the airport you will pass the Ibis Royal literally before you turn right to the Ibis.  The Ibis Royal is a local hotel with vaguely similar graphics that can fool you in the dark and if you're tired ( at no other time however). We stayed there overnight aware we were chumped, as were some others. Actually, not a bad local hotel but make sure your driver turns right after this hotel if you want the real thing, ( and you'll be paying double)

Review Title: We had a very good Time there! Thx to the Ibis Team, especially to the Manager!
Review Text: We spend two Weeks there and where surprised about the great Service and motivated Team there. The Food is good, the Pool Perfect and the Location near the AirPort is Perfect for flightcrews!  Special thx should be given to the Manager Richard and we hope that we come back again.

I  was in Lagos on a business trip for four days and left lagos on 7 April 2012. I have to say the Ibis service exceeded my expectation. I have stayed at a number of Ibis hotel across Europe and the experience in Lagos was similar if not better.. The room was similar to other Ibis hotel rooms. The staff were courteous and helpful.The WIFi worked well and enjoyed music via youtube. The ambience of the hotel was very relaxing and welcoming. Although I did not have time for the pool, the swimming pool was very clean and neat. I enjoyed my stay at Ibis near lagos airport.

As I was used to the standard of Ibis in the UK, I was frankly not expecting anything lesser even though it can be a tricky expectation as this is Nigeria. Generally OK but the management needs to have a look into the following...  1. I requested for a change of the duvet as soon as I checked in as I discovered it was never changed since the last user. Same with the bed sheets as well as the pillow cases. Please do not ask how I got to know.  2. For God sake, help with the room service, and in the least with the Coffee / Tea stuff. I am still expecting the milk I requested for inspite of having checked out! Meanwhile, My request for a pot of tea for room service to be paid for was never honoured.  3.
