I chose to stay at this hotel after seeing a review in Tripadvisor.  The hotel is located very near to the airport and is a most pleasant place to stay after a late night flight into Lagos.  The hotel is very good value for money in terms of hotels in Lagos which are generally to say the least expensive.  The service was good.  There was a breakfast included in the price which was most pleasant.  There is also a nice pool at the hotel.    The rooms are basic but they are clearn and comfortable.  I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Breath of fresh air for Nigeria, well located nearby to the Airport, great for transit/ short stay lodging. Breakfast was good, and had a lot of choice surprisingly. Internet worked fine, room is standard design for the Ibis (Accor) chain hotels, slept well. Everything worked as it should, was pleasantly surprised. Checkout was fine, though check-in was a little worrysome they were running out of ink in the cc machine and asked m to sign a cc receipt without being able to read the content. Fortunately GM was on hand and a printed full invoice was produced.

Review Title: Not Getting Any Better. Wifi Doesn't Work
Review Text: This hotel is not improving in fact it is becoming a stressful place to stay. One of the best attributes this hotel were its staff but sadly standards are dropping. I had some urgent work to complete and the Internet did not work. I called reception they said it will be fixed I called again and again I get the same response. I asked to speak to the manager and was told he has left for the night. The next morning I raised the matter with the manager who refused to accept the Internet was not working stating he had been in the hotel all night and using the Internet. He told me I was wrong because Qatar Airways and Bristow Helicopters use the hotel and they would not accept the Internet not working (they i was told by one of the staff stay on the third floor, I was on the forth

I stayed at Ibis hotel for the first time during a long business trip to Nigeria and was amazed by the services, i received from the manager,staffs and the quality of the hotel itself.Given proximity to airport location,made life safer and easier throughout my entire trip. The front desk is just very friendily, made me feel welcomed and very comfortable. My first experience with ibis prompted my second stay at the hotel recently. My second trip was a bit bizarre after a short trip away from ibis to ghana. On my return to ibis, i shared my ugly experience in ghana with (Mr Richard) MD of ibis and i was really well looked after by Mr Richard. To this end, i feel am part of Ibis family and i would have no reason to stay in a different hotel. I would always love Ibis hotel and i
Review Text

The Ibis Lagos Airport hotel has a great location. It is just couple of minutes away from the airport. After a tiring flight, you just want to get to the hotel and have a proper rest. The front desk staff are very welcoming and do make you feel comfortable. With their smile and friendly approach, it is like 'Welcome Home'.  The room is quite small but the space is enough. The room is clean, always fresh, and equipped with a small fridge.  Anyway, the room is just to sleep as outside there is a beautiful pool just waiting for you to jump in.    The hotel also has a restaurant for breakfast and dinner offering a buffet style service.  As the establishment is not that big, the hotel personnel get to know the guests by their name and maintaining a friendly environment where you can

Review Title: Ok hotel close to the airport
Review Text: This hotel is convenient for those needing to leave early but if you plan to stay long, I would recommend another hotel near Victoria Island as the area near this hotel is not safe at night and we were even warned about walking out in the daytime.

Great location near the airport, stayed here three days and we were happy with the lobby and pool area. Also there is a nice breakfast buffet which was very nice to have. Staff was ok, not exceptional friendly. The room was very small but clean. There was no fridge which is a no-go in a country like nigeria where you wanna keep lots of water. There were no complimentary toiletries in the bathroom which was unconvenient and seems odd for the high price of the hotel room.

Ibis opened to good reviews not so long ago. I was there today and I'm so appalled. The environment was dirty and unkempt. Specifically, there was so much dust on the grounds and fallen leaves. They such that it was obvious that place hasn't seen any cleaning in a week. The glass doors were dirty and smudged.

Arrived in Lagos expected the worst, too many co-workers complaining about the available hotel accommodations.  We arrived late in the evening, tired from a long flight.  The first thing I noticed was the bright and clean lobby.  After check in arrived to my room and immediately noticed the small room size but then an instant later noticed the cleanliness of the room.  WiFi was easily accessible and the Television provided quite a selection of English speaking channels.  I managed to eat breakfast and lunch in the hotel.  They both were well turned out and filling.  Didn't really favor the fish soup though.  All in all, the stay was pleasant, I ate well, and left rested and rejuvenated.  Well Done

The hotel was ideally situated near the airport, meaning reduced costs for transportation to and fro the hotel. The entire staff were very courteous and friendly, which is a nice thing especially after a long and tiring journey.  The first room we were given didn't have a bathroom mirror ( it looked like something that was broken and poorly taken off). We called the front-desk and were promptly awarded another room.  The Restaurant and bar section staff were excellent, always listening and willing to make your meal as enjoyable as possible.  Generally, a very good stay, I would definitely return when in Lagos.

After spending several years in West Africa, and spending several years in various hotels, the Ibis Airport Hotel is like a breath of fresh air. I was greeted by the General Manager, and his front desk staff, who went out of their way to make my stay a very pleasant and comfortable one. Their friendliness and professionalism is five star and I would like to commend each and everyone of them.

I had the misfortune of staying in hotel because I was looking for one close to the airport.The room was very tiny and you have to go downstairs to get anything you wanted.If you become thirsty around 1am you have to go downstairs to get water.It is only in a place like Nigeria that you will see such a contraption and at a ridiculously expensive price.If you think you do not have any other option  you may stay here but do no make the mistake of taking anybody else beside yourself as the room space will choke you all up.

Review Title: Comfy, but most pricey Ibis I ever stayed. Restaurant management needs improvement.
Review Text: Ibis Hotel Lagos is comfy. I would stay there anytime i'm in Lagos more because i stay in Ibis anywhere i go in Europe. But this one is the most expensive at N28,000 or $175. The rooms are clean but the corridors have some leakages from the central cooling ducts which affect the carpet. The food is okay, breakfast is good if you go down not too early and not too late. Restaurant management needs to pay more attention to the place as on 2 occasions during my last stay there was no clean table to sit on. All the previous used cutlery and table napkins had not been replaced. Also the waiters were always in a hurry, one took away my coke while i was still eating.

A very unimpressive hotel.  It's a typical Ibis layout - small rooms, no amenities (no Kleenex, no coffee machine in room, just a bar of soap and tube of shampoo).  This particular hotel is filthy - there is dirt in every corner, the walls are dirty, the hallways are dirty. It is obvious that there is no program in place to "deep clean" rooms periodically.  The only advantage of this hotel is that it is close to the airport.  Unless that is important to you, pick a better quality hotel elsewhere in Lagos and go there.
Review Text

The room and location were good, personnel was courteous.   Except there was hissing sound coming from somewhere (AC or window) that would normally have kept me awake, I slept mainly because I was tired.

My wife and I spent a night here before catching our flight the next day. The room and bathroom were clean. We really enjoyed the dinner buffet. It was quite rich and filling. The breakfast wasn't bad as well.   The only thing I didn't quite like was the smell in my room. Probably a wet carpet smell. But, I did like that I didn't smell any cigarette smoke on my non-smoking floor.  Airport is very close by as well. The Staff were helpful.  We were very happy with our stay.

Review Title: Opinion/Views about Ibis Hotel at Lagos, Nigeria
Review Text: I am a frequent user of this hotel. The location, staff, break fast, and general facility are great. However, here are three major things, in my opinion, that need to be urgently attended to help improve the experience at Ibis Hotel at Airport Road, Lagos. (1) There should be an electric outlet in the bathroom for those who use electric shavers, hair dryer, etc. (2) There should be a small personal refrigerator in each room. (3)  I'm not sure how this could be solved, but the size of the room is way too small for a couple to stay in. As a compromise, since nothing could be done to solve this problem, couples should be allowed complimentary breakfast for the price of single occupant.   I hope my opinion means something to the management of Ibis. Thanks.

Hotel is well equipped with pool, bar restaurant, bar. Comfy beds and clean room. It is a basic hotel but I wasn't excepting much from this type of hotel but did the job for the short time I was there (day stopping!)

Review Title: felt like I was in a dorm room or a solo cruise ship stateroom!
Review Text: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 10 days during the Christmas holiday.  Since my husband had relatives near Lagos, we had them prepay for the hotel to save money, which was a mistake.  If I did not prepay, I would have switched hotels for the following reasons: 1. Most of the staff was not friendly nor helpful.  The staff that handled the breakfast bar was nice and the got you anything you asked for if it was not already out like Spanish omelets (very good by the way) 2.  The selection of the breakfast was ok as I was able to find something to eat.  I am a picky eater. 3. The hotel was built like 4 years ago but they really have not maintained it well.  The room that I was in looked like the hotel had been there for 10 years instead of 4 years. 4.  We asked for extra

Review Title: Falling Standards of the ibis Hotel brand
Review Text: Rooms not clean as ibis London Euston where I regularly stay. Smoke sneaked into the rooms from the AC vents. Pillows not as comfortable as those I use in London Euston. Also they use shower cabin that leaks to the floor unlike the bath tubs at the ibis London  Euston

Review Title: Ibis Lagos Airport Hotel, fully recommend, it's a must by Jay
Review Text: I'd like to congratulate Richard who has done an amazing job in this hotel, he has transform a small team to a professional team, here you always feel like being at home; For travelers (just few minutes from the airport), you can enjoy amenities and the spirit of accor hotels. Great job guys, keep it up and see you next time ...

Review Title: Surprisingly good rather than very good......
Review Text: Quelle surprise as they say en France. After years of over priced hotels in this part of Lagos (the Sheration is now USD 600/night and just as bad as it always has been) up pops the Ibis. OK rooms (Ibis style) with decent showers and really quite acceptable food, WiFi etc all OK.  Well done to Richard and his team. Some parts are already looking a bit 'Lagosian', ie the communal carpets on the bedroom floors most of which have food spilled on them, and the lifts could do with a more regular clean. Lets hoipe they keep up the standards and it doesnt degenerate like the others have.

The location of this hotel is a great asset , for it nearness to the Internationa Airport, it has direct acces to the heart of the Mainland & also the Island of Lagos. The staff are very courteous & friendly. The only thing lacking in the rooms is provision of Fridge becos its not always convinient to move to the Bar for all Drinks especially cold water.

I would congratulate Richard and his staff for the marked improvements since my first visit in March '12 and my recent stay October '12,  The addition of a mini fridge and facilities for coffee make a huge difference. Thanks, GavinR
Review Text

This was a real great deal. B&B at that cost is a steal. The hotel was top notch and was definitely worth more than the cost. The rooms are adequate in size. The food was really good, nice variety. The bar was relatively well stocked. The pool is inviting and we look forward to going back to enjoy it.

Review Title: Good Hotel for Lagos near Airport
Review Text: The Ibis Lagos Hotel is very conveniently close to the Lagos Airport (5 min). You can use airport taxis (ask for accreditation badge first!) costing about N2,500  It has smallish rooms (Ibis style), but well equipped and user friendly. Of course the poor craftsmanship in all Nigerian bathrooms never seizes to amaze me! Good variety TV channels for Nigeria.  Check-in was fast and friendly, likewise checkout.   Breakfast was good and included in the B&B rate of $185. Consist of a combination of cold and hot dishes and the staff friendly and accommodating.  The free wireless Internet access wasn't working on my first night, but once working reasonably fast and certainly good for business purposes. Could Skype occasionally,  Overall a very positive experience and although a little

Review Title: The Staff help to make this Hotel better than it is.
Review Text: I have just stayed at the Ibis (Oct 2012) for two weeks. Overall the stay was pleasant enough considering all things.  The rooms were failry standard IBIS rooms, however the general building standard is lower than european standards, in my room (346) the window did not close properly and therefore the noise level was worse than it should have been, especially when it was windy.  Breakfast was very good, with plenty of choice. The buffet in the evenings was also verygood, perhaps lacking a bit in presentation and at times some of the dishes were a mystery. But generally the food was tasty and plentiful.  My biggest problem was the internet, the free wi-fi system seemed to work well with good signals around the hotel, but the actuall connection to the internet seemed to vary a

The hotel has a really strategic location, just less than 5 minutes form Lagos International Airport. The rooms are clean and most of all the staff are really nice and warm. I must also give an appreciation for the Manager Mr. Robaix who is always there to welcome you and to ask if you need anything and he is a very helpful and nice person. I highly recommend this hotel.

Review Title: Very good service and value for money
Review Text: I recently spent several days at this hotel and found it to be pleasant and good value for money. The check-in process was quick and efficient. The room was relatively small, but neat and clean. The internet access was very quick and always on. Aircon worked well. Breakfast was a good spread and had a good variety. They don't do room service unfortunately, but you can collect your meal from the restaurant and take it up to your room. A good location as it is quite close to the airport and Lagos traffic can be a nightmare at the best of times. All in all, I found this hotel to be a good place to be based in Lagos and would consider it my first choice in Lagos.

Iâ€™d like to congratulate the Ibis Lagos Airport for the excellent services and professional  staff. Thanking specially to the Manager Mr Richard Robaix who is always ready to contribute and help us on any necessity. And it's important to mention the fantastic kitchen and its foods. Very clean and organized. Congratulation!

I had to stay at the Ibis Lagos Airport hotel for a month straight.  Throughout, I appreciated the way the staff from Manager, front desk, bar and kitchen staff went out of their way to make my stay comfortable and enjoyable.  Rooms are clean and the food (buffet) is good and plentiful.

I had to stay over in this Ibis hotel on my way to Benin City. It is the hotel my client always uses when transfer in Lagos. And although the room looked good, with a closer look, a disappointment again. For me the hotel was far overpriced and not worth it. I have had better Ibis hotels for less. Both in Europe as in the Middle East and Africa. When I woke up and wanted to take a shower... no hot water.  When I came back after breakfast to brush my teeth, there was. Not good in a $200 bedroom. Next time, I'll take another hotel.

Review Title: International standard property near Lagos airport
Review Text: I stayed one night at the Ibis Lagos Airport on a business trip to Nigeria last week. The hotel is a typical international Ibis property that could easily be transplanted into a European city without blinking an eye. Rooms are clean, staff are friendly and helpful, airconditioning works, wifi is complimentary (and not too slow) and food is edible. What more can one really ask for at this proximity to MMIA. It isn't cheap, but compared to the other properties nearby its value proposition is far far superior. Definitely my choice for future visits to Ikeja.

I am a big fan of IBIS hotels they are well designed, good value and you know what you are getting. I have stayed at IBIS Hotels in London, Bristol, Dubai, Singapore and Hong Kong. I like the IBIS Dubai City Centre so much I have a corporate deal with them for all my visitors.   I had Â been looking forward to staying at the IBIS Lagos. At last a reasonably priced hotel in Lagos run to IBIS standards. I must say that I was a little disappointed. The hotel staff are nice and fairly efficient. The lobby area and the restaurant are typical IBIS. The breakfast was excellent with the bread, croissants and pastries probably the best I have had in Lagos. Now for the bad news the rooms. If you can get your contacts to meet you at the hotel, you can have a pretty successful meeting. Review Title: Another visit to my favourite Hotel in Lagos
Review Text: The General Manger Monsieur Robaix was overseas during my visit earler this month. The staff, as usual were politer and efficient. Room clean and all facilities were working well. I true sign of good management that although the G.M was away the staff continued to uphold the high standards they have been trained to maintain. Wi fi had a 2 hour problem which was fixed quickly. Bravo.

Everything are ok but the wifi signal for my room is not good. Thus, I have to take my laptop and iPad to the lobby to get online.  Moreover, the bar didn't offer me discount for my accorhotel membership (paid membership).

I am having a problem the Wi-Fi connectivity in room is not stable.  I need to bring my gadget to the lobby to check mail and make internet call.   food selection is not much but good enough.  and it is not cheap though everything in Lagos is expensive.   I am a paid member for accorhotel that I may visit this hotel again.

Review Title: My preferred hotel in Lagos when combining price and quality
Review Text: I've travelled to Lagos off and on since 2005.  Finding a place that is good value, convenient and a reasonable standard is not easy.  I've to stayed at the Four Points Sheraton but wanted a less-expensive option, closer to the airport.  I found the Ibis on-line and wasn't sure what to expect.  I stayed at Ibis twice during my recent trip to Lagos.  I had good experiences both time.  Yes, the rooms are small, but the public areas on the main floors are big and pleasant; I was able to get some work done in them.  The food is good. The service is excellent: I had trouble with the Internet (it was so slow), told the manager and he called the hotel's Internet service provider and had the Bandwidth increased. Review Title: Very nice hotel cheaper and much cheaper than some other "western" hotels in Lagos!
Review Text: I think the Ibis was a very nice hotel.  I would definitely recommend it and will likely stay there again.  It's along the lines of  Hampton Inn for Americans reading this review.  The two meals I ate at the hotel were very good.  The evening buffet is mostly Nigerian food....I would have preferred more "western" choices....but it was good.  Service in all aspects of the hotel was very good.  One word of warning.....when visiting this hotel for the first time, do not get it confused with another hotel with Ibis in it's name which was just a few buildings down.  My taxi originally took me to the other hotel.  Thankfully, I had looked at enough phtotos on the Accor website to realize it was not the hotel that I had booked.

Excellent stay with easy access to international and local airports.  Breakfast buffett was very good although with a breakfast window of 4 to 11 a.m needed refreshing quite frequently.  Staff very pleasant and friendly.   Only criticism was the smell of paint on the first floor as I believe it had recently been applied.  Would stay here again and again and was a very nice stay.

No thrills no frills hotel - does what it says on the tin.  No complaints though and would stay there again unless looking for a boutique experience (but then that would be a different matter). Friendly helpful staff.

Review Title: Functioning hotel in a very difficult terrain
Review Text: It is good to finally have a functioning hotel very close to the International Airport in Lagos, Nigeria. The staffs are very personable  and they sometimes go out of their ways to make guests happy; a very big PLUS!    As for thr size of the room, it is barely large enough for one person and would not recommend it for a double occupancy.

I checked into Ibis hotel, Airport road, Ikeja, Lagos.  The hotel is quite clean, very well located within Lagos, at least for the travellers heading out of town.  The breakfast is quite good, other meas are also fair enough in taste and quality. The facilities are nice and the rooms are quite clean, but a bit on the small side ( comparatively). It is quite a simple and functional hotel,  especially if it is used as a layover spot for a trip.  However, the internet services in the rooms are nit satisfactory and most times, you would need to come down to the lobby to use it effectively ( including right now that I am sending this trip advise)  Thanks  Gbulasilgba.
Ibis is  nice enveroment is good and the staffS are friendly too. Each time am in lagos I stay in ibis and my kids loves it so am good its a value for ur money.

Booking into an Ibis I set my expectations accordingly..I know Ibis has small rooms, they are not 5 star, etc...I have to say, this hotel met my expectations to the "T"....rooms were clean and comfortable but very small, the bathroom was clean and as expected no toiletaries were provided (except for soap). The bed was on the hard side but I slept well. The bar and buffet breakfast was fine, the backup generators worked a treat. I really cannot fault it.

I regularly transit through Lagos en route to Port Harcourt and have used this hotel on many occassions since its opening in 2011. It's in a good location just a few minutes from both International and domestic terminals at MMA and in typical Ibis style is great value for money especially when compared to other overpriced options in the city. The staff are well trained and friendly, the food is good and the security excellent. It gets my vote every time.

Review Title: Very good value in an overpriced town
Review Text: Lagos is ridiculously overpriced for hotels, so we decided to stay at this hotel near the airport. It was very close to both terminals, clean, and served bar food through the night (which was a relief, as we had flown non-stop from New Zealand, so were very confused about what time it was!), Staff were friendly, the pool was clean and the buffet breakfast was fantastic. Would definitely recommend as an airport stopover. Rooms were small but functional and it was really quiet. May even go back for a long weekend. Good value in Nigeria, where standards are often lower than this.

Itâ€™s a good hotel and the rates fit into your budget. The rooms are high standard rooms but surprisingly very low rates. Keep it up. I have stayed here three times within 7 weeks. This hotel is now my first choice hotel. I suggest they introduce pick up options for their customer traveling since it located close the domestic and international airports.
Ibis is a value for your money the staffs at the restaurant are nice. The food ibos is a place to be.

This fairly new hotel where the car registrations boast "Centre of Excellence" is exactly thsi. An Oasis in this throbbing metropolis. Since my last visit the gardens are taking shape with Bourganvilia and other tropical plants and shrubs around the pool area. Inside the high standard of sevice and maintainance continues. Free internet acces is continuos throughout the hotel. The rooms are clean, airconditioned which changes rapidly from normal power to generation very quickly.  The sevice remain excellent The wine kist now has more depth than on earlier visits. The Chef has become more creative offering excellent hot food at the evening Buffet. Chapeau to Monsieur Robaix and his team. A bientot mes Amis

Review Title: Good value, clean and comfortable hotel
Review Text: The hotel is nothing spectacular but for those travellers that require accomodation close to the airport this is one to consider. The hotel itself was clean, tidy and secure, with a walled compound and security guards on the gate.  I didn't get to use the pool, but it looked well maintained.  The food is nothing to set the world on fire, but it's ok. There is a reasonable choice at the breakfast buffet, and there is an evening buffet (which I did not try). There are bar snacks available too.  I was there on business, and with my colleague had a comfortable stay. If I was going back to Nigeria this would be a place I would consider returning to.

I ended up at the Ibis after a series of travel mishaps, so was not in a great mood. I was immediately impressed with the lobby and staff. Dinner was a buffet, with a great selection. And to find FREE high speed internet? Wow!!! Considering the cost in Nigeria and that it is not free in a lot of hotels I've been in places like London, LA, Chicago, Rome - that is awesome! The central A/C was great, so much so I only got to breakfast at 9.30 am! I slept beautifully. The shower was powerful and just what I needed.  Breakfast was also a buffet - well stocked, with the chef and his assistants keeping an eye on it all and making sure guests were satisfied.  Lunch was a buffet starter, and a la carte main. Food choice simple and expensive (US$ 27 for a Club Sandwich !). Would stay there again and can recommend in case you go out for work all day as nothing to do in the hotel and you won't go for a walk there. Near  the airport.

I was many time in this hotel and I was always treated well. It is save , personal is frieddly the room are ok  but it is for the quality a little to expensiv. it has a large pool , but it is not so clean as in other part of Afrika. security is good, in all my 15 year of 6-8 times a year staying there never something got stolen. wifi is  there ,but it cost money.

To be a guest at Ibis Hotel in Nigeria makes you as guest feel you like home. Good service, polite employees with good customer centricity. The management at Ibis have done a great work to create a customer oriented environment. Thanks

Service is ok. Response to Email Enquiry very prompt. The room is neat. Only that it is still cold after AC was switched off. The Location is ok for Travellers (Very Close to Airport). The Location is too busy for relaxation. I did not have enough time to use all the ammenities. The Resturant staff is too loud while talking to other guest and I guess proffessionally they should not get too familiar.

Since May, 2011, I have been using Ibis Hotel Lagos and there has been continuous improvement of facilities to meet up with customers demand. One fascinating thing is the presence of the Manager at all times attending to clients, finding out their challenges and making sure his team provides possible solutions.  I commend the leadership of this hotel.  we will continue to patronize this hotel as long as this kind of leadership and service continues. The waiters are very friendly, they encourage try new food.  It is a fantastic place for business because you feel good and this critical for business trips.

I want to thank Richard Robaix and his excellent staff for their tremendous hospitality. Richard has built a team who know exactly what good servce is all about, and who are willing, courteous and friendly, and always have a smile.  The hotel's location is good, and the rooms although compact are well thought out and have all that one requires.  The buffet and restaurant menu provide an excellent variety of local and international dishes. Travelling overseas on business, staying in many hotels, I have yet to find a hotel where the GM and staff match the friendly and efficient service that Richard and his team offer at the Ibis hotel, near Lagos airport.

Good hotel, made better by the fabulous staff. Rooms are small but perfectly clean and functional. Beds are comfortable, a/c works and is quiet enough to sleep through, shower is good with plenty of hot water. My only negative is that the room could have done with a small safe in it for my valuables. Overall a great place to stay when on business in Lagos, look no further book the Ibis airport, Lagos...

I would like to say Thank You for all team from the Hotel Ibis Lagos, Nigeria. It's important to mention that is a new hotel and extremely confortable and clean. Excellent breakfast and meal services. Also, always a special coffee 24 hours per day. And, their location is only 5 minutes to the int'l airport. I was visiting their kitchen and it's very clean and organized. Congratulation! Edmundo Ghabril

brilliant attentive staff,esp ugo and praise. stayed two nights,would have loved to stay longer.would definetely stay here again when in lagos. good choice of food for breakfast and lunch. fabulous shower

The New Ibis hotel near Lagos airport is a credit to the brand.  Under the constant direction and supervision of the General Manger Richard Robaix,  the staff are gaining confidence. Always friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is peaceful in this modern well maintained hotel. An "Oasis" away from the hussle and bussle of "Lagos life".  The bedrooms are well designed, comfortable, well insulated allowing no outside noise. The hotel wi-fi is a Godsend for the business traveller.  The Chef provides a high standard of Buffet and gives the traveller a chance to try some well prepared African dishes as well as the normal Euopean fare.  Chapeau to you Lagos Ibis. A credit to Group Accor and to Lagos, "Center of Excellence" !

Review Title: we loved it and it will be the only place we will stay in lagos
Review Text: please let it be known that richard robiax and his team of proffesionals are by far the best service team that I have had in all my travels abroad. richard is the manager and he goes beyond his call of duty to assist in any way he can whether it is dealing with the various embassies in lagos or wether it be helping you book flights when you are in need of his assitance. richard has many contacts in various locations to help with about any thing you may need. and to top that off the service there is impecable and the resturant has a very good cheff that has vast knowledge of all international dishes. so if you need a hotel that is very clean and  the best priced in lagos this is the place you need to look for. thanks Richard for all your help God bless you and your team

Review Title: Good food, clean hotel, helpful staff
Review Text: Very refreshing to find a reasonably priced hotel close to the airport. Staff were efficient, helpful and friendly. We had to wait a while for the food to be replenished but there was a good mix of local an European dishes. The room is typically and almost uniformly Ibis- compact, and onl basics provided. Almost broke the window trying to open it to get some fresh air! Internet connection included in the room rate and working perfectly.

Review Title: Best place close to Lagos Airport
Review Text: IBIS Hotel Lagos Airport.  Ibis hotel near Lagos airport is ideal hotel if you have early morning flights or late evening flight as traffic is is horrendous to & from Lagos/ Victoria Island/ Ikoyi areas. The hotel is a secured location with small sized rooms with a place to dine / have  drink. The menu is overall smallish. The hotel is very functional and is ideal if you are in town for a day or 2. Its close to the airport so u will definitely not miss your flight. In lagos people usually start 3 pm from their hotels for an 11 pm flight due traffic issues. I would suggest this hotel to anyone who is transiting through Lagos and has some time at hand as the airport does not have any facilities to even sit. Stayed twice at the Ibis Lagis airport in the past two weeks.  The first trip was for 4 days, the second just for one night.   The first thing that strikes you upon check-in is the friendliness of the staff - they seemed delighted to have you there.  This cheerfulness was maintained throughout my stay, and I was very impressed that the staff greeted me by name every time I went near reception.   As expected from an Ibis, the rooms are not huge, there is no room service etc. However, being used to Ibis I was not concerned about this.  In contrast to previous reviews, I actually thought the hotel was in very good order and well-maintained.  I had no problems at all during my stay.
